subhead: The West condemns Beijing's social and environmental model, yet continues to benefit from it. Its blind dependence on Chinese 'green' technologies is the result of this hypocritical approach, researcher Isabelle Feng argues.

title: Four charged with plotting New Year's Eve bomb attacks in Southern California, prosecutors say
subhead: First Assistant US Attorney Bill Essayli said on Monday that the bomb plot, detailed on an eight-page handwritten plan, 'was explicit,' with 'step-by-step instructions to build IEDs,' listing 'multiple targets across Orange County and Los Angeles.'

subhead: The 78-year-old filmmaker and his 68-year-old wife were found stabbed to death in their Los Angeles home on Sunday, December 14.

title: War in Ukraine: 'The EU has too few cards to hesitate over playing the financial one'
subhead: The 27 member states must soon decide the fate of €210 billion in assets belonging to Moscow. Marginalized in peace negotiations, the European Union now has the chance to assert its influence in resolving the conflict, argues Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.

title: Trump's FBI purge: 'We are not trending toward an authoritarian force. We are at one'
subhead: Since returning to power, Donald Trump has relentlessly sought to reshape the federal law enforcement agency. In his eyes, it is guilty of investigating him and people close to him. He has set out to bring it to heel by firing dozens of agents.

title: Mory Sacko, the calm celebrity chef: 'I have no score to settle with life'
subhead: He rose to fame on 'Top Chef' in 2020 and has since become a charismatic figure in France's new wave of gastronomy. At the helm of Mosuke, his Michelin-starred restaurant in Paris, Mory Sacko has created a small culinary empire built on joy and serenity.
